### Software

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation on PiecesOS startup issues:

**Key Points Raised:**

* **Multiple users reported issues:**
    * PiecesOS stuck at "ensure core dependencies" stage during startup. 
    * App icon disappears from the system tray.
    * PFD cannot connect to PiecesOS.
* **Potential causes identified:**
    * Outdated version of the app.
    * Conflicts with OneDrive on Windows.
    * Underlying issues related to the migration process.
* **Solutions proposed/implemented:**
    * 11.1.1 and 11.1.2 updates released to address startup issues.
    * Manual removal of com.pieces.os folder from OneDrive.
    * Restarting the app on macOS.
    * Patch to prevent future hangs on macOS desktop app (version 3.3.8).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Most users have reported successful resolution of their issues after updating to 11.1.1 or 11.1.2.
* Remaining issue for rogierlegit on macOS may be resolved by restarting the app or by waiting for the 3.3.8 desktop app update.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users are encouraged to report any new issues by creating separate issues on GitHub.
* The link to create a new issue may not work properly in Firefox on Windows.

## Recommendations:

* **Update to the latest version of PiecesOS (11.1.2).**
* **Check for and remove the com.pieces.os folder from OneDrive.**
* **Restart PiecesOS app on macOS.**
* **Report any ongoing issues on GitHub with as much detail as possible.**
* **Consider waiting for the 3.3.8 desktop app update if on macOS and experiencing issues.**

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failure due to AVX2 requirement
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to launch after upgrading to version 11.1.1. The issue stemmed from a new dependency on the AVX2 instruction set, which some older CPUs lack. This caused immediate crashes on launch. The Pieces team addressed the issue by releasing version 11.1.2, removing the AVX2 requirement and resolving the launch failures for affected users.

## Conversation Summary on PiecesOS Issue #620

**Key Points Raised:**

* User `GetReal444` is experiencing issues booting up PiecesOS.
* The issue appears related to a database extension requiring AVX2 instruction set, which is not supported on the user's machine.
* Additional reports suggest this issue might be affecting more users.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS database extension has a hardware requirement (AVX2) not met by some users' machines.
* This compatibility issue prevents users from launching the application.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team is working on a patch to resolve the dependency on AVX2.
* Users are advised to update to the latest 11.1.2 version of PiecesOS, which includes the fix.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved with the release of PiecesOS version 11.1.2.
* User `GetReal444` confirmed that the issue is fixed after updating to the latest version.

**Additional Notes:**

* The team is actively working on a more permanent solution that does not rely on AVX2.
* Users experiencing similar issues are encouraged to update to the latest version of PiecesOS.

**Overall:**

The Pieces team identified and quickly addressed a compatibility issue affecting some users' ability to launch the application. The issue has been resolved with the latest update, and the team is actively working on a more permanent solution.

- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue #625

**Key Points Raised:**

* User [@gonzososa](https://github.com/gonzososa) reported the `PiecesOS` application fails to launch on their Mac.
* The user's system uses an Intel® Core™ i5-3210M CPU, which lacks AVX2 support.
* [@hra42](https://github.com/hra42) identified the root cause as CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch requiring AVX2 support. 

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS crashes on launch due to unsupported CPU lacking AVX2.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team proposed a new release with a fix.
* Version 11.1.2 was released for users to update to. 

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User [@gonzososa](https://github.com/gonzososa) confirmed the fix resolved the issue.
* [@hra42](https://github.com/hra42) reported the user as satisfied with the outcome. 

**Notes:**

* This issue highlights the importance of checking hardware compatibility before installing software requiring specific features like AVX2.
* The Pieces team quickly identified the problem and released a fix, demonstrating their responsiveness to user issues.

related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Rohanrathi99 is experiencing problems with making requests to PiecesOS cloud services and local models.

**Problems identified:**

* Potential firewall or network configuration blocking outgoing requests from PiecesOS.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces requested Rohanrathi99 to provide logs for com.pieces.os && com.pieces.pfd.
* Rohanrathi99 uploaded the requested log files to their Google Drive and shared the link.
* Mark-at-pieces requested access to the files and Rohanrathi99 granted access.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Mark-at-pieces is currently reviewing the log files to diagnose the issue.

**Additional notes:**

* Rohanrathi99 can also schedule a real-time debugging session with Mark-at-pieces.

## Key Takeaways

* The issue is likely related to network connectivity.
* Mark-at-pieces is actively working to resolve the issue.
* Rohanrathi99 has provided the necessary information to assist with troubleshooting.

## Recommendation

* Continue to monitor the issue and follow up with Mark-at-pieces for updates.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User (@DevWizard24) reported an issue with PiecesOS not launching.
* The issue appears to be related to hardware requirements in version 11.1.1.
* User (@GetReal444) experienced the same problem.

**Problems identified:**

* PiecesOS version 11.1.1 has stricter hardware requirements than initially anticipated.
* This is causing the app not to launch for some users.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The Pieces team is working on a patch to resolve the issue.
* Users are requested to provide logs from their `c://Users/{USERNAME}/Documents/com.pieces.os/production/Support` folder to help diagnose the problem.
* A new release (11.1.2) is planned to be released soon to address the issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The patch has been released as version 11.1.2.
* Users are encouraged to update to the latest version and report if the issue persists.
* The issue is considered resolved unless further reports are received.
